channel.title: blender tuts.
channel.description: Hi. ive been hanging around here on bm forums for some time now, and ive been looking at some good modeling jobs done by various people. ive been using blender for the last week but to my dismay i ahvent been able to create much. for those who use blender or are just awsome could anyone help me find tutioriouls? what things did you use to start you out. did you jsut use blenders homepage? jsut help me out with these questions and i will try and give back

i see well thank you agian im jsut glad i have a free refrence thing to help get started.

item.title: blender tuts.

item.description:
Settle downâ€¦ I toyed with Blender for a while (almost a year) without really progressing, then I decided to sit down and complete a project with it all at once, and ended up getting competent at using it over a weekend. Basically by looking up the process one step at a time in Noob2Pro.

item.title: blender tuts.
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
This is the single most useful resource to help you learn Blender:

https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Blender_3D:_Noob_to_Pro

There is good stuff here:
https://www.blender.org/education-help/

There are also quite a few video tutorials on Google Video/Youtube.

If you have specific questions you can search/post on the blenderartists.org forum.

Read full topic

item.title: blender tuts.
item.dc:creator: Iblis
item.description:
Hi. ive been hanging around here on bm forums for some time now, and ive been looking at some good modeling jobs done by various people. ive been using blender for the last week but to my dismay i ahvent been able to create much.
for those who use blender or are just awsome could anyone help me find tutioriouls? what things did you use to start you out. did you jsut use blenders homepage? jsut help me out with these questions and i will try and give back
